lead_paragraph: After years of battling the effects of Parkinson’s disease, the former cycling star Davis Phinney got some long-awaited relief. Doctors in Palo Alto, Calif., activated a pacemaker that was embedded earlier this month into his brain, and after several hours of adjusting the settings of the device, Phinney, 48, had no detectable tremor on the left side of his body and was walking with far more ease than usual.
